history.proof: unfold cs_safe. split; intros Hcs_safe. - shelve. - destruct Hcs_safe as (b & pf & Hcs_step). split. + shelve. + shelve. + shelve. + shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: input -> option nat
prec: input -> bool
prec_valid: forall i : input, prec i -> exists v : nat, f i = Some v
cls: seq nid
cs: seq nid
Huniq: is_true (uniq nodes)
to: nid
this: nid
d: dstatelet
msg: seq nat

Goal:
cs_safe this to d msg <-> (exists (b : heapUMC) (pf : cs_safe this to d msg), cs_step pf = Some b)

Premises:
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Record dstatelet : Type := DStatelet { dstate : lstate_type heap; dsoup : soup }
cs_step : forall (this to : nid) (d : dstatelet) (msg : seq nat), cs_safe this to d msg -> option heapUMC
Notation nodes := (cs ++ cls)
heapUMC = UMC.Pack {| UMC.p := fun k : ptr_ordType => k != null; UMC.mixin := heapUMCMix |} : union_map_class ptr_ordType (dynamic id)
uniq : seq ?T -> bool where ?T : [f : input -> option nat prec : input -> bool prec_valid : forall i : input, prec i -> exists v : nat, f i = Some v cs : seq nid cls : seq nid Huniq : uniq nodes this : nid to : nid d : dstatelet msg : seq nat |- eqType]
cs_safe = fun (this to : nid) (d : dstatelet) (msg : seq nat) => [/\ to \in cs, this \in cls, coh d & prec msg] : nid -> nid -> dstatelet -> seq nat -> Prop Arguments cs_safe _ _ _ _%seq_scope
nid = nat : Set
Some : ?A -> option ?A where ?A : [f : input -> option nat prec : input -> bool prec_valid : forall i : input, prec i -> exists v : nat, f i = Some v cs : seq nid cls : seq nid Huniq : uniq nodes this : nid to : nid d : dstatelet msg : seq nat |- Type]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Notation seq := list
input = seq nat : Set
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
ss_safe_def : forall (this to : nid) (d : dstatelet) (msg : seq nat), ss_safe this to d msg < -> (exists (b : heapUMC) (pf : ss_safe this to d msg), ss_step pf = Some b)

unfold cs_safe. split; intros Hcs_safe.
- destruct Hcs_safe as [H1 [H2 [H3 H4]]].
  exists (cs_step Hcs_safe). exists Hcs_safe. reflexivity.
- destruct Hcs_safe as (b & pf & Hcs_step).
  split. apply Hcs_step.
